intro: Trattinnickia rhoifolia, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Trattinnickia rhoifolia is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its low maintenance requirements.
